item.title: Why Floaters Feel Worse When You're Alone with Your Thoughts
item.description:
You’re finally alone. No phone. No noise. Just quiet.
And suddenly… you notice it.
That same floater — drifting, dancing, stealing your peace.

And you wonder:

Why do floaters feel worse when I’m alone with my thoughts?

It’s not your imagination.
There’s a real psychological reason why stillness makes visual distractions feel louder.

Let’s break it down.

The Brain Craves Noise — Until It Doesn’t
